question: 悪例
sourceMnemonic:
A <kanji>bad</kanji> <kanji>example</kanji> is a <vocabulary>bad example</vocabulary> and is something you don't want.

This is a formal expression and less common than <ja>悪い例</ja> (bad example) or <ja>良くない例</ja> (not good example).
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
